Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior: glazed black with part of reserved tondo; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of galloping horses (four forelegs, with incised fetlocks remaining) to right; below scene, black zone with reserved band; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0526) (Phase 1)
